summary: In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, "probiotics" are categorized under "functional food," a preferred term that encompasses food products purported to confer health benefits beyond basic nutrition. The regulatory landscape governing functional foods, including probiotics, is defined by EU legislation aimed at ensuring consumer safety and accurate labeling. Probiotics are often subject to specific health claims regulations, necessitating scientific substantiation to validate their efficacy. As a redirect term, "probiotics" highlights the broader category of functional food, emphasizing the importance of regulatory compliance in marketing these products within the EU market.
